Telescope.synopsis: The player interacts with a telescope at a druid grove, looking out at the scenery and potentially spotting a dragon in the sky.

individual_metadata.synopsis: Nadira is a witty tiefling that survived Avernus and escaped with a soul coin, a valuable currency of the Hells. She suspects the player works for the original owner of the coin, a devilish erinyes, and will have to be persuaded in order to hand it over.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: There are two sessions provided: one named 'Telescope' and one with an empty name which seems to describe an interaction with Nadira. From the synopsis and trigger details, there are no explicit instructions or narrative dependencies indicating that one session should occur before or after the other, nor is there any indication of mutual exclusivity between them. Therefore, no ordering or exclusivity constraints can be derived from the given data.

Telescope_3.speaker: Narrator
Telescope_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: player sees the landscape ahead through the telescope lens - the dragon is gone

Telescope_15.speaker: Player
Telescope_15.text: Squint at the distant object, trying to make out further details.

Telescope_6.speaker: Player
Telescope_6.text: Focus the telescope on the distant object, trying to get a clear view.

Telescope_0.speaker: Narrator
Telescope_0.text: *You recognise the dragon as the mount of a githyanki knight. Perhaps it had been tracking the ship.*
Telescope_0.context: NodeContext: spoken only by gith players - a mixture of hope and doubt - watching the dragon through a telescope

Telescope_17.speaker: Narrator
Telescope_17.text: *You see a red dragon. Tyrannical, greedy and vain; they hunt without pity.*
Telescope_17.context: NodeContext: spoken only by sage and sorcerer players: shocked to see this creature here. watching it through a telescope so no immediate danger

Telescope_25.speaker: Narrator
Telescope_25.text: *You see a dragon circling like a bird of prey. Hunting.*
Telescope_25.context: NodeContext: watching the dragon through a telescope so fear but no immediate danger

Telescope_26.speaker: Player
Telescope_26.text: Move the telescope to the left.

Telescope_11.speaker: Player
Telescope_11.text: Move the telescope to the left.

Telescope_22.speaker: Player
Telescope_22.text: Move the telescope to the right.

Telescope_5.speaker: Player
Telescope_5.text: Move the telescope to the right.

Telescope_4.speaker: Narrator
Telescope_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: the player look toward the crash-site through the telescope - tendrils of smoke still rising

Telescope_19.speaker: Narrator
Telescope_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: the player sees a very distant column of smoke (waukeen's rest) through the telescope

Telescope_24.speaker: Narrator
Telescope_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: player sees a view of the landscape through the telescope - there is an object moving in the sky, some distance away

24.speaker: Nadira
24.text: You got what you came for. Just go somewhere else.

36.speaker: Nadira
36.text: That coin's worth plenty. Don't let a squid get their tentacles on it.

47.speaker: Nadira
47.text: From hellspawn to angry druids... I'm definitely buying my way to Baldur's Gate.

73.speaker: Nadira
73.text: Would have been breathing my last if your friend hadn't killed that bugbear.

27.speaker: Nadira
27.text: So, thank you. Not a lot of people watching my back these days.

77.speaker: Nadira
77.text: You have good timing. Never been much of a fighter, so wrestling a bugbear would have gone poorly.

86.speaker: Nadira
86.text: But you're not here for heroics, are you? Avernus' stench is all over your skin.

20.speaker: Nadira
20.text: Let me guess: your devil mistress sent you to get her soul coin back. Too bad. I earned it fair and square.

75.speaker: Karlach
75.text: Oh man, a soul coin? Wouldn't mind getting my hands on that...
75.context: NodeContext: Very interested but maybe downplaying her interest.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: A soul coin, eh? Whoever it belongs to won't let it go easily. You ready for that?

68.speaker: Nadira
68.text: Yes. No. Argh. Bloody thing's been almost more trouble than it's worth - and it's worth a lot.

60.speaker: Nadira
60.text: The fact that you haven't made a play for it yourself is... interesting. Who are you?

40.speaker: Player
40.text: My 'devil mistress' can go fuck herself. I don't serve Zariel - or anyone.

98.speaker: Nadira
98.text: Yet I'd clock you as one of her bruisers a mile off. You want me to believe you reek of Avernus by, what, coincidence?

42.speaker: Player
42.text: I'm Karlach. If you've spent any time in Avernus, you might've heard of me.

54.speaker: Nadira
54.text: My gods. Of course. Zariel's prize soldier. You must know what it's like trying to evade a devil better than anyone.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: I ran away from Zariel's service the first chance I got. I'm making a new life now.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I've been to Avernus, but I'm no devil's servant.

1.speaker: Nadira
1.text: But you're not from Elturel, either. I can tell.

102.speaker: Nadira
102.text: Care to explain why you reek of the Hells?

93.speaker: Player
93.text: You wouldn't believe me if I told you.

33.speaker: Nadira
33.text: Considering what I've seen? You'd be surprised.

22.speaker: Nadira
22.text: But if you're not here for the coin, I'd rather enjoy the quiet. There's not much of it anywhere else.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: A mind flayer abducted me, and its ship went straight to Avernus.

26.speaker: Nadira
26.text: And I thought I was doomed. Now I feel sorry for you.

76.speaker: Nadira
76.text: Here. Take this. It's worth a fortune. But a fortune's not worth much if you're dead. Consider it payment for saving my life.

114.speaker: Karlach
114.text: Deadly. Wait 'til you see what I can do with that thing.
114.context: NodeContext: Happy the player got their hands on a soul coin, which she can use to supercharge her engine.

90.speaker: Narrator
90.text: *A soul coin, true to its name, holds a mortal soul inside. It serves in the Nine Hells as very valuable currency.*

23.speaker: Nadira
23.text: It's a soul, wrapped up in a terrible iron package. Don't ask whose, because I don't know.

110.speaker: Nadira
110.text: I hope it brings you better luck than it has me.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: I can put this to really good use. Thank you.

107.speaker: Nadira
107.text: I'm glad someone can. Better in your hands than a devil's.

69.speaker: Nadira
69.text: Worthy of a coin, I think, except... someone seems to have picked my pocket. Gods damn it all.

96.speaker: Nadira
96.text: Sure. And my father's the Dark Prince!

32.speaker: Nadira
32.text: Look, I appreciate you killing the bugbear, but this coin is all I have. So thank you, but leave me alone.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: How about this? You give me the coin. Now.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: No, I don't. But that coin of yours is mine.

116.speaker: Nadira
116.text: I'm going to be chased all over Faerûn for this damn coin, aren't I?

6.speaker: Nadira
6.text: Fine. Take it as a grudging payment for the rescue. Now leave me in peace.

53.speaker: Nadira
53.text: And now I've misplaced the cursed thing! You know what? Good riddance.

11.speaker: Nadira
11.text: I think not. Go and strip the bugbear for parts if you're that desperate.

101.speaker: Nadira
101.text: Since you did... kill him. And I appreciate that part. So thanks.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: That bugbear would have crushed your skull. This is the thanks I get?

44.speaker: Nadira
44.text: Why thank you, dread slayer of bugbears. You shall live forever in my memory.

16.speaker: Nadira
16.text: Now take my regards back to that pouting erinyes and leave me alone.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: The coin, now. Or you can be alone in your grave.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: You got me. Hand the coin over and I'll be on my way.

12.speaker: Nadira
12.text: That bloody erinyes. Devils just can't stand to lose.

10.speaker: Nadira
10.text: Here. Now go back to the pit that made you.

67.speaker: Nadira
67.text: And I... I don't even have the coin anymore. Beshaba take me, just bugger off.

113.speaker: Nadira
113.text: My mother's a warlock. Taught me when a fiend's tongue is twisting.

94.speaker: Nadira
94.text: You might be hell-sent, but you're a bad liar.

48.speaker: Nadira
48.text: What's that saying? Honesty late is honesty halved?

61.speaker: Nadira
61.text: So I'll call us even. Let me go back to relaxing away from all the noise down below.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: You hand the coin over, or I kill you. How about that?

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Bad liar, but good killer. The coin - now.

28.speaker: Nadira
28.text: Considering you turned that bugbear into paste...

18.speaker: Nadira
18.text: ... that's a fair trade. Here. Take this soul back to the damned place it came from.

99.speaker: Nadira
99.text: ...that's a good trade. Except the coin seems to have slipped through a hole in my pocket somewhere. Damn it.

97.speaker: Nadira
97.text: I talked an erinyes out of her favourite soul coin without blinking. And you're not half as scary as she was.

78.speaker: Nadira
78.text: So thanks for the rescue, but you're welcome to the bugbear's spoils, not mine.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Your mother and I have a lot in common.

25.speaker: Nadira
25.text: Gods, I hope not. I left home at sixteen for a reason.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I promise I'm not working for that devil.

74.speaker: Nadira
74.text: I'm sure there are other bugbears to kill. Best of luck finding them.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: How in the hells could you know about that?

104.speaker: Player
104.text: The Blade of Frontiers cavorting with devils? Don't be absurd.

106.speaker: Nadira
106.text: Quite the title. Means absolutely nothing to me.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: The path I follow is far more noble - if you possess a devil's artefact, you should leave it in my charge.
